text: Toni Golem (; born 14 January 1982) is a Croatian former professional footballer who played as centre or right back on defence. He currently works as an assistant manager of Croatian club Hajduk Split. ==After retiring== After retiring in 2012, Golem began his coaching career at his former club, Hrvatski Dragovoljac. He signed a contract until June 2014.Glasnik 38/13 - HNS-a, hns-cff.hr, 27 August 2013 He worked in the staff until just before the summer 2017.Glasnik 30/17 - HNS-a, hns-cff.hr, 11 July 2017 He then joined the staff of manager Željko Kopić in Slaven Belupo, functioning as an assistant coach.“Znam da od igrača tražim puno”, telesport.telegram.hr, 26 May 2017 On 13 November 2018, Željko Kopić was appointed as the new manager of Hajduk Split, where Golem followed with him, remaining as his assistant.Zeljko Kopic appointed as new head coach, hajduk.hr, 13 November 2018 In the end of November 2017, Golem finished his UEFA Pro Licence.TONI GOLEM OBRANIO DIPLOMSKI RAD I STEKAO UEFA PRO LICENCU, hajduk.hr, 22 November 2017 Golem left Hajduk in the summer 2018.
